page.title: 13RELIGION,PURTON STOKE
page.content:
A public meeting place was set up by the{Quakers}in Purton Stoke.On 14th October 1721 Amy Davis married William Absleep there.From detailed records of births,marriages and burials we can discover the names of some of the villagers who supported that cause.They include Shurmer, Thomas,Fitchew,Messenger,Fisher, Carter,Bath,Waine and Sallis.The site of the meeting place is thought to be where number 22 is now along Water Lane,and their burial ground was at number 38.
Over 100 years later in 1832 Purton Stoke Society built a {Methodist Chapel for Â£160 opposite the present shop on land bought from Jonas Bathe. In 1868 it was decided to move to another site and so the building was pulled down.
